page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content:
TRANSPORT
Served by the railway until 1953, then replaced by a service of buses, Stanhoe was finally deprived of all its public transport five years ago. A private coach runs through the village from Wells to King's Lynn on Tuesdays and Saturdays (market days). Under a self-help scheme, a mini-bus manned entirely by volunteers is provided to help fill the gap and started about three years ago, plies between four neighbouring villages, connecting with service buses to King's Lynn, Heacham, Hunstanton and Fakenham. It also goes to Burnham Market twice a week. It is based in Docking and is available for private hire, especially for clubs and outings.
